programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les has to call security when an argument over a missing item turns violent, a high-stakes gambler visits the shop for funds and a customer tries to sell a gynaecologist's table.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les causes a stir when he tells a woman her gold bracelet is fake, and Seth later struggles to determine whether a watch is priceless or worthless.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les makes a decision on impulse that threatens to backfire, and later gives a big loan to a customer with a dubious sob story.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Danielle accompanies Mike on a pick while Frank looks after the shop, and the first-time picker strikes gold when she spots a derelict hotel filled with treasures.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz discover a train station full of vintage cars, and make some surprising finds in an old barn.

programme.title: Grave Trade
programme.desc: The return of the documentary following the work of East End funeral directors T Cribb & Sons, beginning with the discovery of a body by archaeologists in Amesbury.

programme.title: Grave Trade
programme.desc: The undertakers organise a funeral for a Romford market trader, while an archaeological expedition unearths some skulls that reveal information about Iron Age burial practices.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick and the team repair a 1960s popcorn machine, and a client brings in an antique air compressor.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: While Rick is away, his brother Ron takes matters into his own hands when a client brings in a 1900s love tester. Is this a match made in overhaul heaven?.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les causes a stir when he tells a woman her gold bracelet is fake, and Seth later struggles to determine whether a watch is priceless or worthless.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les makes a decision on impulse that threatens to backfire, and later gives a big loan to a customer with a dubious sob story.

programme.title: Search for the Lost Giants
programme.desc: Brothers Jim and Bill Vieira investigate accounts of giant skeletons being found across America, to determine if these stories are true and who the bones belonged to.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The team members attempt to uncover the US military's first responses to UFO encounters, prompting them to revisit a suspected UFO crash site in California.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Investigating claims that the Third Reich used extraterrestrial technology, and a speculative report asking whether the legend of Atlantis could be a preserved memory of an ancient alien metropolis.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick and the team try to restore a 1960s Nasa helmet, and a rusty gas cart is in need of transformation.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick and the team renovate a 1940s chocolate dispenser to a tight deadline, before turning their attention to a 1950s fridge.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick saddles up and heads out to look at a 1980s Sigma Derby horse racing game, but it remains to be seen whether it will be worth a gamble.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chum is over the moon when a pair of 1960s space robot toys arrive at the shop, but the owners asking price may bring him back down to Earth.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Orange You Glad Dan Sold It Again?
programme.desc: At an auction in Burbank, California, a new buyer challenges both Barry and Jarrod - and ends up buying a locker that is packed full of surprises.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders head for an auction in Costa Mesa, where they encounter several new faces. Brandi and Jarrod look for stock to sell in their new shop.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: New store owner Lesa gets started on running the business, while Ricky and Bubba examine a vintage air compressor and Moe discovers some stunning lithographs.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders face tough competition when they find themselves up against 100 rivals at an auction in Longview.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: The four judges pick past bladesmiths to represent them. First, the smiths forge signature blades before creating the Ida, a sword that originated in West Africa.

programme.title: Search for the Lost Giants
programme.desc: Brothers Jim and Bill Vieira investigate accounts of giant skeletons being found across America, to determine if these stories are true and who the bones belonged to.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The team from UFO Magazine investigate investigates videos indicating a strong UFO surveillance presence at weapons laboratories.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: An investigation into whether advanced technologies, such as lasers and sonic weapons, are merely rediscovered tools used by advanced beings in the past.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les struggles to forgive Seth for trying to sell his business and decides to lock himself in the office. Meanwhile, a fight breaks out on the shop floor.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les faces a dilemma over the authenticity of a rare guitar and, with no expert on hand for advice, he is forced to go with his gut instinct.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders attend an auction in Laguna Niguel, where Barry buys a mysterious safe with unknown contents and Jarrod and Brandi acquire a collection of toys.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry is accompanied by two beautiful women to the auction, while newcomers Rene and Casey purchase a statue that could be worth thousands of dollars. Elsewhere, a professional wrestler appears at an appraisal.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Two rare and huge GI Joe playsets are deployed to the shop on the outskirts of Las Vegas.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A letter said to be signed by Napoleon makes Rick stand to attention. Other items under consideration include a surreal figure by Mexican artist Pedro Friedeberg, a 1960s Monkees talking puppet and original Dick & Jane illustrations.

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Gus has his eye on a Citroen XM that looks amazing - but it's in France. Will isn't sure, but the engineering challenges win him over.

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: British car enthusiasts Will and Gus have just one week to try to fix neglected cars and double their selling price - risking their own money in the process.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Orange You Glad Dan Sold It Again?
programme.desc: At an auction in Burbank, California, a new buyer challenges both Barry and Jarrod - and ends up buying a locker that is packed full of surprises.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders head for an auction in Costa Mesa, where they encounter several new faces. Brandi and Jarrod look for stock to sell in their new shop.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Joe Lycett, Ivo Graham, Phil Wang
programme.desc: Stand-up comedian and author Joe Lycett plays host in this show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo. He warms up the audience and then introduces routines by fellow funny men Ivo Graham and Phil Wang.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Marcus Brigstocke, Gary Delaney and Zoe Lyons join host Dara O Briain and panellists Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison for another round of the satirical news quiz from July 2012.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Former Labour home secretary Alan Johnson takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedian Janey Godley and journalist and political commentator Tim Shipman joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: Jo Brand, Chris Martin, Tommy Tiernan and Alun Cochrane join Alan Davies around the table to discuss modern male grooming habits and dating unsuitable men.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: Stand-up comic and QI panellist Alan Davies is joined in conversation by Phill Jupitus, Stuart Maconie, Pippa Evans and Carl Donnelly.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim Warwood and Adam Gendle take downhill mountain-bike racing to the next level by adding more wheels.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: James is called to a man threatening to throw himself into a river, and Nadiene and Matt head out to a man with learning difficulties who is giving sheltered housing staff trouble.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: While combing through an impressive collection, Mike finds a rare Ford, and the guys pick a Tennessee home hiding a big secret.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: A monster scares the bidders, while Brandon and Lori bet big on a DJ's equipment.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: The bargain hunters head to an airport auction and compete for luggage and plane parts.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The picking gets red, hot and blue in a Louisiana warehouse as Mike makes a move on Gypsy Grandma, the queen of arcade games.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank visit South Carolina, where they find a collection of brass instruments, an art deco fan, and a hoard of rare collectibles.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Major body work is needed when the suspension and engine don't fit the Haunted Rod. Steve flips a 1920 Old Wayne Gas Pump to offset extra labour costs.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond find second-hand bargains for the same price as the £6,995 Nissan Pixo. James May is in Nevada to test the toughness of the Range Rover Evoque, driving it through Death Valley before chauffeuring a megastar across Las Vegas. Plus, the McLaren MP4-12C is compared with its supercar rival the Ferrari 458 Italia, and four-time Formula One world champion Sebastian Vettel is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers in Hidalgo are forced to close the bridge when it's stormed by dozens of asylum seekers trying to jump the queue of people waiting to seek refuge in the USA.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: The crew get creative when tasked with an iron-worker themed rat rod that doubles as a work truck, while Steve tries to flip a beat-up 1967 Coronet found in a junkyard.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The trio try to make train travel cheaper, faster and more interesting, replacing the locomotive with a specially modified car and the carriages with a series of caravans. Comedy star Rowan Atkinson gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car and Jeremy Clarkson drives the Jaguar XKR-S and a Nissan GT-R round the track to compare both models.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson tries out the Lotus T125, which brings F1-style performance to the track, and an updated version of the classic Jensen Interceptor. Bob Geldof gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car, and the trio employ all manner of second-hand military equipment to knock down a row of derelict houses, aiming to complete the job in less time than a team of demolition experts.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sara Pascoe, Colin Lane and Jimmy Carr join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig for an extended edition of the comedy panel quiz show. This time, the theme is 'Opposites'. During the course of the show, the panellists find out how to sort the sheep from the goats, discover the opposite of Tarzan, and meet the telescope that points straight through the Earth. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window, as the fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Angela Scanlon, Clive Myrie, Sara Pascoe and Rick Edwards test their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games this week, with the daily winner declared following a quick-fire round at the end of the show.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedy panel show, hosted by Rob Brydon, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by celebrity guests Danny Dyer, Jon Richardson, Moira Stuart and Joe Lycett to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedy panel show, hosted by Rob Brydon, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by celebrity guests Bob Mortimer, Gabby Logan, Katherine Parkinson and Steve Backshall to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Joe Lycett, Ivo Graham, Phil Wang
programme.desc: Stand-up comedian and author Joe Lycett plays host in this show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo. He warms up the audience and then introduces routines by fellow funny men Ivo Graham and Phil Wang.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Alex Horne takes scrupulous notes as Paul Sinha squats in a telephone box, and Iain Stirling stakes his claim for the Scottish national football team.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions on the theme of long-lost things. Joining regular panellist Alan Davies are Madness frontman Suggs, Australian comedienne Claudia O'Doherty and stand-up Jimmy Carr, who are all hoping they don't fall into the QI elves' traps and set off the klaxon.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions on the theme of landmarks. Joining regular panellist Alan Davies are comedienne Jo Brand, Australian stand-up Colin Lane and comedy writer and actor David Mitchell, who are all hoping they don't fall into the QI elves' traps and set off the klaxon.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A formerly luxurious and strategic mountain-top villa on the island of Rhodes in the Mediterranean that's been ravaged by acts of revenge by locals since 1955.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The untold secret story of war production that shaped the Second World War, beginning with how the German aviation industry came to dominate the skies of Europe.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Documentary offering an insight into some of the events in the Bible, beginning with the story of the Ten Plagues. In the Old Testament, the Book of Exodus describes the epic battle between the prophet Moses and Pharaoh. Experts offer various various explanations for the 10 plagues of Moses and the mass exodus of the Hebrew slaves out of Egypt, a story that is a cornerstone of the Jewish, Christian, and Muslim faiths.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Investigating the Turin Shroud, which is a length of linen cloth that some believe bears the image of Jesus. Cameras follow the efforts of a scientist trying to prove whether the cloth truly is Christ's burial robe.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Full Steam Ahead
programme.desc: The team discover how the combination of increased leisure time and affordable rail transport brought a new kind of freedom for working-class Victorians. Ruth Goodman travels along the south Devon coast from Paignton to Kingswear, where she helps prepare a paddle steamer for a journey up the River Dart, while at Swanage, Peter Ginn finds out what it was like to work on the excursion trains and the impact mass tourism had on the area.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Airbus A380, which as the largest passenger plane ever built can carry more than 850 people non-stop nearly half-way around the world. With the largest wingspan of any commercial aircraft and four specially developed mighty turbo jet engines, the A380 weighs 560 tonnes and getting it off the ground would not have been possible without the work of past innovators such as George Cayley and Frank Whittle. Key developments in aerospace engineering - from Richard Whitcombe's energy-efficient wing-tip designs to Nasa engineers' cutting-edge control system, Fly by Wire - helped bring the A380 to fruition.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: How Europe's most advanced power station became a film set. Plus, the structures made by scientific pioneer Nikola Tesla in his quest to provide the US with free electricity.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates this documentary chronicling events leading up to the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbour on December 7, 1941, and the subsequent collapse of unprepared British forces before the advancing enemy in Singapore. Includes interviews with veterans from both sides.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to Jerusalem in search of Solomon's Temple. When the Romans sacked the city in 70AD, the fabled Treasure of Solomons was believed to have been looted and taken back to Rome. However, it is possible it was hidden away by the High Priests. Archaeologists Dr Shimon Gibson and Kate Raphael have dedicated their lives working out what actually happened, and discuss whether it is possible that Solomonic and Roman treasures lie undiscovered under Jerusalem.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Airbus A380, which as the largest passenger plane ever built can carry more than 850 people non-stop nearly half-way around the world. With the largest wingspan of any commercial aircraft and four specially developed mighty turbo jet engines, the A380 weighs 560 tonnes and getting it off the ground would not have been possible without the work of past innovators such as George Cayley and Frank Whittle. Key developments in aerospace engineering - from Richard Whitcombe's energy-efficient wing-tip designs to Nasa engineers' cutting-edge control system, Fly by Wire - helped bring the A380 to fruition.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson hikes up from Lyme Regis on Dorset's Jurassic Coast to the Somerset Levels in the footsteps of a ragtag rebel army led by the young Duke of Monmouth, the illegitimate son of Charles II. He sailed in from Holland around Lyme's famous Cobb with a handful of soldiers, believing the people would support him in overthrowing the newly crowned James II, who was also Monmouth's uncle, but, more importantly, Roman Catholic. The year was 1685 and the country was riven by anti-Catholic feeling mixed up with revolutionary zeal. Monmouth marched through the fiercely independent towns of Devon, gathering support from artisans and farmworkers. Meeting up with Billy Bragg in Colyton, Tony learns about the kind of people prepared to risk their lives for the Monmouth Rebellion.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston talks to author Joy Hancox about the alchemical roots of London, the design of famous buildings such as The Globe theatre and the mysterious figure of English poet John Byrom. He also meets a modern day potion-maker.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Veteran naturalist David Attenborough explores the fragile marine ecosystem of the coral reef, where all creatures, including the corals themselves, have to fight for survival. From tiny beginnings, the reef grows and develops over hundreds of years, providing support for innumerable animals - yet one storm can threaten the entire community.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Kevin Norris and Kieran Chisnall move three state-of-the-art trains, fresh in from Japan. They need to transport them from the North East port of Redcar to a factory in Doncaster.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: How Europe's most advanced power station became a film set. Plus, the structures made by scientific pioneer Nikola Tesla in his quest to provide the US with free electricity.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates this documentary chronicling events leading up to the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbour on December 7, 1941, and the subsequent collapse of unprepared British forces before the advancing enemy in Singapore. Includes interviews with veterans from both sides.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: The crew visits Germany to collect a multi-million-pound maintenance machine so large it will need to be loaded onto two trucks. Eric and Chris oversee a diesel-engine exchange.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The stories behind closed roads, including a route once used by the French Resistance and areas made impassable by crumbling hills and sand dunes.

programme.title: David Jason: Planes, Trains and Automobiles
programme.desc: The actor flies into the heart of a volcano, gets a surprise in a drag-racing car, hits the road with an American trucker and takes to the skies in a vintage Second World War plane.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek dives into the lost Jowett marque, as a Bradford-built 1952 Javelin finds an unexpected home. Paul and Dave uncover a Ford Escort that's been untouched for 30 years.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Railways built to cross inhospitable conditions, including the San Diego desert, one of Switzerland's highest mountains, and an infamous jungle railway built by prisoners of war.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Barker and Corbett present more classic comedy sketches, with a song from Tina Charles and another episode in the gripping period drama Hampton Wick.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Trevor Eve and Sue Johnston star in the first of a two-part story. A woman who went missing from a care home in 1986 is found brutally murdered in a burnt-out car, and the team discovers she had recently abducted a teenage girl herself. As the investigation continues, both cases appear to be linked to an urban myth about a character known as the Bag Man - an eyeless villain who kidnaps children. With Eva Birthistle, Tara FitzGerald and Wil Johnson.

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: Two bodies are discovered on a life raft in Ystad harbour, the victims having been shot through the head and had their tongues burnt off with acid. The heavily tattooed corpses reveal links to the Russian mob and are instrumental in proving the men originated from Latvia, so Major Karlis Liepa, an officer with the country's police department, is sent to work with Wallander. But an anonymous phone call, a shooting and a break-in at the police HQ soon convince Wallander of a leak in the investigation - and he immediately suspects Liepa. Guest starring Soren Malling (The Killing), with Kenneth Branagh as the world-weary detective.

credits.actor: Kenneth Branagh as the world-weary detective

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the stunning Rowden Gardens on Dartmoor - one of the participants in the National Gardens Scheme.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Eleanor opens her new infirmary for the poor, but also agrees to help in her father's private practice. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The lads reach South Africa where they help complete the building of a medical centre, leading to romance for Jeremy, who falls for one of the nurses. Meanwhile, Andy Butcher lands himself in deep trouble after a kind-hearted gesture to help a destitute local family leads to accusations of ivory-poaching.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Yvonne is horrified to learn Beverley was assaulted by her own husband and promptly alerts CID, only for the case to take an unexpected twist when the culprit insists he acted in self-defence. Jim puts his marriage on the line by succumbing to his gambling addiction yet again, despite a stern lecture from June and threats from an angry loan shark. Jack returns to Sun Hill, determined to reassert his status as top cop, but his colleagues doubt whether he has fully recovered from his heart attack.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Donna urges Jess to stop pining for Zubin and get on with her life - and new anaesthetist Sean might be just the tonic she needs. Connie and Will bury the hatchet, and Owen discovers Diane is still taking contraceptive pills despite claiming she wants a baby. As Tricia undergoes her first radiotherapy session, Chrissie finds a lump in her own breast and makes an urgent appointment to get it checked out. Samantha Beckinsale guest stars.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Jude and Matt face an awkward time at work after their one-night stand and Kate returns to the hospital following Trevor's death. Meanwhile, a single mother who is smuggling drugs in her stomach arrives for treatment after being dragged from the river bound and gagged. Lisa Coleman, Jason Merrells and Sorcha Cusack star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Tough former Met officer PC Roger Valentine joins the team and immediately makes a good impression by cracking down on muggings in the Sun Hill area - but his old-fashioned attitude toward homosexuality threatens to ruffle a few feathers when he's partnered with Lance. Jim continues to struggle with his gambling addiction and chilling CCTV footage of Abi makes Samantha fear for her daughter's safety.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: On Mother's Day, Etta is concerned about Lloyd's friends, while Sharon worries about the decrease in takings at the pub.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ignoring his family's advice, Lloyd goes looking for adventure.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The group draw lots to decide who will get to have Christmas Day off duty, and Josie and Bayleaf spend the night together. Starring James Hazeldine and Katharine Rogers.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish antiques dealer gets involved in a con at a country house involving the sale of a fake painting in exchange for a parcel of diamonds. However, Lovejoy later realises he too has been set up over the deal. Richard Griffiths guest stars, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: A recently paroled convict takes his son to Jersey without telling the boy's mother or his parole officer. Detective drama, starring John Nettles.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Adrian, who has been writing his memoirs, makes a decision that will change his life. Joey has reached the end of his tether.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Old Mr Grace recognises a photo of Mr Humphries' mother and begins to suspect the head of menswear may be his son and heir. John Inman stars.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean is concerned for Lionel's success as the day of his book launch arrives and wonders if Alistair will be able to help out with a publicity stunt should sales start to flag. Romantic comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Yours Truly - If You're Not Careful
programme.desc: Billy and Alvin learn that Truly's ex-wife is trying to find him, and waste no time in gleefully tormenting their pal with the news of a strange woman's appearance in town. Long-running comedy, starring Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: The chief inspector comes up against Rattigan, an old adversary from his days in London, whose legal challenge to his prison sentence has been upheld on the grounds that Gently fabricated evidence against him. Donald McGhee, the detective's friend and former colleague in the Met, unexpectedly arrives in Durham to offer support, but his motives remain questionable. With Bacchus torn between loyalty and ambition, Gently knows that it's up to him to find a solution to his dilemma. Sixties-set detective drama, starring Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby, with Kevin Whately, Diana Quick, Nigel Lindsay, Morgan Watkins and Ralph Brown.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gerry is spooked by the discovery of UCOS's latest victim - a cop, whose body has lain untouched under a basement for 30 years. As accusations of police corruption and underhand dealings begin to surface, Gerry has to face up to some skeletons in his own closet and it's a race against time for the team to help before his murky past catches up with him. While babysitting his grandson, Gerry becomes convinced that only he holds the key to the investigation and goes Awol to uncover the truth. Starring Dennis Waterman and Denis Lawson.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: The detective and sidekick Jardine investigate when a prominent loan shark dies after being brutally attacked with an axe. Jardine starts a relationship with an actress who is playing Lizzie Borden in the studio that owns the apparent murder weapon as the duo come to believe it may be a revenge killing - and that there could be a link with Glasgow's Garden Festival. Celia Imrie guest stars, with Mark McManus and James Macpherson.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Recently single teacher Laura Nielson is set up with Andrew Earlham, a widowed surgeon and the father of one of her students. The two enjoy a first date, but the next day rumours and accusations begin to circulate and the two find themselves entangled in a web of deceit and confusion. Thriller, starring Joanne Froggatt and Ioan Gruffudd, with Shelley Conn, Zoe Tapper and Warren Brown.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of five answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Tony Blackburn talks about the success of BBC Radio 2's Sounds of the 60s Live, which toured the UK throughout 2019 and a raft of new dates have been added for 2020

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and topical studio discussion from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David and the team are in Milton Keynes, where a ceramic egg attracts David Ford's attention, Tracy Thackray-Howitt buys a gold cigarette case and Mark Stevens eyes up some Iranian portraits in gold.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five members of a family from Lancashire answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants James, Joe, Shelley and Helen pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather

programme.title: Emmerdale

programme.title: Coronation Street

programme.title: The Martin Lewis Money Show
programme.desc: It can get pretty tough in January with Christmas bills flooding through the nation's letterboxes, so the financial journalist and Angellica Bell are on hand to help navigate new regulations relating to overdrafts. Plus, there is a look at consumer rights when asking for a refund.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Long-running drama with the residents of England's most famous cobbled street.

programme.title: Cold Feet
programme.desc: Adam finds himself in hot water at work, while his relationship with Karen continues to affect the group. Jenny has finished her cancer treatment, but her struggle is far from over, while David begins to see Mary in a new light. The return of Mike Bullen's comedy drama, starring James Nesbitt, Fay Ripley, Hermione Norris and Robert Bathurst.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's headlines from a Scottish perspective, plus local news from Aberdeen, Edinburgh and Glasgow.

programme.title: Welcome to HMP Belmarsh with Ross Kemp
programme.desc: Part one of two. The documentary maker goes inside the walls of HMP Belmarsh, the country's most notorious maximum-security jail, which has housed the country's most dangerous - and infamous - convicts, including Ian Huntley, Ronnie Biggs and Charles Bronson. Ross explores how staff cope with high-profile inmates, extremists and common criminals living side-by-side and goes inside the High Security Unit, where he meets Muhammad Asif Hafeez, known as Sultan, the alleged mastermind of a drug-smuggling empire.

programme.desc: Wayne Carini advises on how to sell an exceptional car collection, including a Mercedes 500K and a 1922 Mercer.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini prepares to attend the Pris d'LeMons car exhibition, and hopes his Volvo P18 Wagon will stand out among the vehicles on show.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Ron Pitts goes behind the scenes of more moments of destruction, including storm chasers who run into trouble, a paint factory that explodes and a plane crash at sea.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Ron Pitts goes behind the scenes of more moments of destruction, including two sports cars colliding at great speed and a massive explosion at a refinery.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard visits Britain's oldest number plate maker. Plus, Paul and Drew disagree about adding a mega engine onto a tiny Italian classic..

programme.title: Darts: BDO World Championships
programme.desc: Day eight from indigo at The O2 in London.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The manufacture of Kamaz trucks and hair-care products and the construction of Chinese landmark building the Canton Tower.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Sculptor Nick has his skills stretched by an equestrian piece with classical connections. Plus, leather expert Martin works on a piece of luggage once owned by Russian royalty.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The Aleutian Ballad is left without power after being hit by an 80-metre wave during a storm. Meanwhile, the Maverick is in trouble after an inspection by the coastguard and the Northwestern's success is cut short by a problem with one of the hydraulic lifts.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Military equipment collector Bruce Crompton heads to Finland looking for props, including Cold War Russian anti-aircraft guns, for a new blockbuster movie.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Steve Graham finds himself up the creek without a paddle on a desert island delivery. Yogi runs out of road, and two concrete specialists head off the map and into trouble.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads to Italy to grab a genuine junior supercar, but when he arrives back in the UK, expert technician Edd China realises that extensive work needs doing.

programme.title: Supertruckers
programme.desc: The truckers move millions of pounds worth of Army vehicles through the streets of Wiltshire for the annual Trowbridge Armed Forces Day.

programme.title: Secrets of the Underground
programme.desc: Rob Nelson heads to California to investigate a network for major fault lines that could set off a mega-quake. Plus, he explores a mysterious sinkhole.

programme.title: Railroad Australia
programme.desc: Documentary shedding light on the work of railway staff responsible for transporting train passengers through the blistering heat of the vast Australian wilderness.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The Rollo endures rough seas, while the men of the Aleutian Ballad are left in darkness when their vessel is almost capsized by a huge wave. The boats head back to the harbour, where crew members find out how much they will be paid before returning home.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Following a team of dredgers based in Nome, Alaska, trying to collect gold from the bottom of the unpredictable Bering Sea.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits one of his favourite houses and discovers a design classic, and later visits a museum in a giant windmill.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Jonny Rayner faces a difficult choice, as he decides whether to cross a crocodile-infested river or delay his journey.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China work on an old Aston Martin DB7, hoping to restore it to its former glory but hidden problems threaten to blow their budget.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Blacksmith Neville has his expert skills tested with the restoration of a cast iron 19th-century fireplace. Plus, Alex restores a 1930s table into a farmhouse centrepiece.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to a huge antiques wholesaler in Exeter, where he finds pile upon pile of affordable gems. Next, it's on to north London, to visit an emporium of curiosities.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Husband-and-wife truckers Nick and Jo recover a 70-year-old war plane. Elsewhere, a delayed flight to an outback town threatens to leave a mobile heart clinic without a doctor.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: King Crab season kicks off with a 12 million pound Bairdi quota increase that causes a fishing frenzy. Plus, a boat is stolen the night before launch.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Estranged brothers John and Lonnie are complete opposites. Now, they're united by their need to lose weight while they still can - and save their relationship.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Sometimes blood relations lead to bloodshed - when murder becomes a family affair. Here, investigators turn to forensics to uncover sinister plots within families.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: Robocop's box office success proved that audiences were desperate for blood spurting gore. However, cne fan couldn't wait to copy the bloodiest scenes for the ultimate revenge.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murder of self-made millionaire Buddy Parker's 26-year-old daughter Tara Swilley, who died after the carpet company owner's home was raked with gunfire by an embittered business associate in August 2004.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The bloodiest gun battle in the FBI's history, which occurred on April 11, 1986, when agents attempted to apprehend two suspects responsible for a prolonged crime spree.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: A dead puppy is found chained up in an abandoned house, and a cat hoarder is encouraged to give up some pets.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: The surgical team tries to help a porpoise that has been left blind by a cataract.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown operates on a dog with a large mass hanging from its back leg.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: High School Musical star Corbin Bleu helps his fiancee choose a dress, while a bride disagrees with her fiance over the style of gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Kara wants a red dress for her big day, but her future mother-in-law has more traditional ideas. Meanwhile, Sheena needs a gown for her Indian wedding reception.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Hard-to-please bride Rene brings along her even pickier mother, while Nnenna's mum grows tired of her daughter's indecision.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Dr Kate anxiously awaits her dog's test results. Dr Danni volunteers at a pop-up clinic, while Dr Alex has a house call check-up with a pig and her piglets.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The SPCA seizes a hoard of sick animals, including several roosters, a goat and a pregnant cat. Plus, investigator Scott Wernick confiscates numerous dogs that have been left to fend for themselves.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The team tries to rescue more than 100 animals, including 50 dogs, from some of the worst living conditions its members have witnessed.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore salvages three more items from a tip in Witley, Surrey, transforming a redundant car bonnet, an old wax jacket and a dated desk.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When forensics investigate the murder of an American woman, they suspect a serial killer might be on the loose.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Investigating the rape and murder of a woman at the dry-cleaners she worked at. Police had eyewitnesses but when their descriptions were not clear, they turned to forensics.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Jarrod Johnston, who was 17 years old when he vanished shortly after leaving his grandmother's Mississippi home in July 2007.

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
programme.desc: Sasha Wass and Jeremy Dein re-examine a case of murder and mistaken identity from 1900, when a woman's body was found among the sand dunes of Great Yarmouth. A clue from her clothing allowed the police to name her as Mary Jane Bennett, and suspicion immediately landed on her estranged husband, Herbert Bennett.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The consultants find the pressure is on to make sales in the current economic climate. Audrey remodels a gown and Vera rescues a fitting when she alters a neckline.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride Mirjana needs to walk out of the store with a dress that same day, while wedding planner Bethany is looking for a dress to top all others.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Consultant Sarah struggles to find a dress for choosy bride Bernadette, while nurse Marcie is unable to make a decision.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Maria brings three generations of her family to her appointment, while Pamela is on the hunt for a grand ballroom-style dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Heather brings her three bridesmaids to the store, Meredith has no idea what style she is looking for and Isabel is accompanied by her fiance and fashion guru.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Magdalonie brings five very opinionated bridesmaids along with her for her dress appointment, while rugby player Michele, who has lymphoma, arrives with her fiance, mum and aunt.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Meghan is getting married in two weeks but she doesn't recognise her dress when she goes for her fitting, can it be fixed or will she buy another new gown?.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Joan gives the sales consultants advice on how to manage a bride who cannot make a decision without the help of her mum, or when the mother of the bride takes over.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard is on a mission for quality, heading to a decorative antiques dealer in Royal Tunbridge Wells, Kent. In Dumfries, he seeks hidden treasure in a furniture collection.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore salvages three more items from a tip in Witley, Surrey, transforming a redundant car bonnet, an old wax jacket and a dated desk.

programme.title: Being Reuben
programme.desc: With Reuben struggling to focus on his schoolwork and dump his sweets obsession, mum Vicky is at breaking point - so she gives him an ultimatum.

programme.title: Being Reuben
programme.desc: Reuben takes his father Matthew with him on his first big business trip to New York. A shoot with a top photographer means the pressure is on for Reuben to impress.

programme.title: Sister Wives
programme.desc: The jewellery business begins to overwhelm the women and they have turn to investors for money to hire employees.

programme.title: Raising Tourette's
programme.desc: Documentary following families raising adolescents with Tourette syndrome, a tic disorder characterised by involuntary, repetitive movements and random - sometimes obscene - vocalisations. High school senior and Tourette's sufferer Kristen and her mother Rebekah brace for homecoming and new 'kid on the block' Kaden reveals his condition to his classmates.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: Agents search for a man accused of murdering his wife - but when they discover a friend of the victim has also been killed, they fear the fugitive may have a list of other targets.
